Participants.evidence: 103 ABI patients with NGT indwelled for more than 1 month were retrospectively studied

Objective.evidence: Objectives: To investigate the characteristics of pharyngeal and laryngeal structure in patients with acquired brain injury (ABI), who were long time wearing nasogastric tube (NGT) with or without tracheostomy.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Epiglottis shape abnormality, glossoptosis and pharyngeal stenosis were present in a larger proportion of the NGT–TRACH (nasogastric tube with tracheostomy) group than the NGT group ( p < 0.05).
